results.title: Why Obsessive K-Pop Fans Are Turning Toward Political Activism
results.abstract: After claiming some credit for the fizzling of President Trump’s rally in Oklahoma, the online armies of Korean pop music listeners are feeling prepared and empowered.

multimedia.caption: A crowd of K-pop fans at the annual KCON convention in Newark in 2015. The genre’s enthusiasts have been starting to exert their influence in a new realm: the American political arena.

results.title: N.Y.’s Legal Limbo: Pandemic Creates Backlog of 39,200 Criminal Cases
results.abstract: A justice system based on face-to-face meetings has been limping along with virtual hearings, but officials are struggling with how to restart trials and grand jury proceedings.
results.byline: BY ALAN FEUER, NICOLE HONG, BENJAMIN WEISER AND JAN RANSOM

results.title: Supreme Court Limits S.E.C.’s Power to Recoup Ill-Gotten Gains
results.abstract: But the justices rejected a request that they rule the agency can never sue for disgorgement of profits obtained by fraud.

multimedia.caption: A spokesman for the Securities and Exchange Commission said that the decision on Monday “allows us to continue to strip wrongdoers of their ill-gotten gains and return money to its rightful owners.”

results.title: Mixed Signals on Israeli Annexation Reflect Split Among Officials
results.abstract: U.S. and Israeli officials are divided on whether annexation is a means to get Palestinians to the table, or whether the peace plan is a means to get annexation.
results.byline: BY DAVID M. HALBFINGER AND MICHAEL CROWLEY

results.title: Apple Confirms Shift Away From Intel Chips in Macs
results.abstract: The move, announced in the live-streamed start to the company’s conference for developers, marks the end of a 15-year partnership.

multimedia.caption: “When we look ahead, we envision some amazing new products, and transitioning to our own custom silicon is what will enable us to bring them to life,” Apple’s chief executive, Timothy D. Cook, said on Monday.

“When we look ahead, we envision some amazing new products, and transitioning to our own custom silicon is what will enable us to bring them to life,” Apple’s chief executive, Timothy D. Cook, said on Monday.

results.title: France Brings 10 Children of French Jihadists Home From Syria
results.abstract: About 270 children of French citizens remain stuck in Syria, according to rights groups, which argue that leaving them stranded in squalid detention camps exposes them to illness and radicalization.
results.byline: BY CONSTANT MÉHEUT AND BEN HUBBARD
org_facet: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

results.title: John Rankin, Grant Proposal Writer Who Loved Languages, Dies at 65
results.abstract: Mr. Rankin was a proposal writer working in the Washington area before a series of strokes beginning in 2013 left him disabled. He died of the coronavirus.

results.title: Betraying Frustration with China, E.U. Leaders Press for Progress on Trade Talks
results.abstract: A first summit meeting between a new European leadership and China’s Xi Jinping yielded little, not even a joint statement.

results.title: David Guillod, Hollywood Executive, Charged With Sexual Assault
results.abstract: Mr. Guillod, a former talent manager and an executive producer of the film “Atomic Blonde,” was charged with 11 felony counts including rape, his lawyer said.
